body.p: What is the function of the variable region of an antibody?

feedback.p: Incorrect.T cell receptors bind with MHC complexes.
Correct. The variable region is the part of the antibody that changes which allows immunoglobulin (i.e., IgG) molecules of the same class to bind thousands of different molecules.
Incorrect. Complement is activated by the constant region of an antibody.
Incorrect. Cytokines bind to cell surface receptors not antibodies.

body.p: What is the function of the constant region of an antibody?

feedback.p: Incorrect. T helper cells bind to the MCH, not antibodies.
Incorrect. The variable region of the antibody binds antigen.
Correct. When an antibody is bound to an antigen the constant region of the antibody can interact with complement proteins and activate them.
Incorrect. Cytokines do not bind antibodies, they bind receptors on the cell's surface.

body.p: Which of the following is not a function of antibodies?

multiple_choice.choice: Antibodies can act as an neutralizing agent

feedback.p: Incorrect. Antibodies can bind to proteins which could make them inactive.
Incorrect. Bacteria that are covered with antibody molecules cannot function normally.
Incorrect. When antibodies bind to free floating antigens the cause them to clump and precipitate out of solution.
Correct. Neutrophils are part of the innate immune system; they do not respond to antibodies.
Incorrect. The constant region of the antibody activates complement.
Incorrect. When antibodies are bonded to a foreign cell, that cell will be recognized and phagocytized or activated complement will poke holes in the membrane leading to opsonization.
Incorrect. This is a monomer.
Correct. This is a pentamer.
Incorrect. This is a monomer.
Incorrect. This is a dimer.

body.p: Which class of antibodies is mainly found in sweat, tears, breast milk and GI secretions?

feedback.p: Incorrect. IgG is mainly found in blood as part of the secondary immune response.
Correct. IgA is one way infants acquire passive immunity while their immune systems mature
Incorrect. IgM is mainly found in blood usually associated with a primary immune response.
Incorrect. IgD is found attached to the surface of maturing B cells and is not usually found as a free antibody.
Incorrect. IgE is found associated with mast cells and the allergic response as well as some parasitic infections.
